snippet: A planned expansion of the San Diego Convention Center is leaving limited space for exhibitors. So companies have started to think outside the box. Or outside the convention center.
abstract: Advertising column observes a planned expansion of the San Diego Convention Center is leaving limited space for exhibitors, such as those at Comic-Con International; notes companies are thinking outside the box, with the biggest off-site events being held in hotels and nightclubs in the nearby Gaslamp Quarter.
lead_paragraph: A planned expansion of the San Diego Convention Center is leaving limited space for exhibitors. So companies have started to think outside the box. Or outside the convention center.

headline.main: Not in the Convention, but Still Part of Comic-Con
headline.print_headline: Not in the Convention, but Still Part of Comic-Con
